## Definition

Let $S$ be a [numerical semigroup](../Basic-concepts/Numerical-semigroup.qmd) [minimally generated](../Basic-concepts/Minimal-set-of-generators.qmd) by $P(S) = \{n_1, \ldots, n_e\}$. It is defined for each $i \in \{2, \ldots, e\}$ ,

$$
\alpha_i = \max \{h \in \mathbb{N} ~ | ~ h n_i \in Ap(S, n_1) \},
$$ where $Ap(S, n_1)$ denotes the [Apéry set](../Basic-concepts/Apery-set.qmd) of $S$ in $n_1$. It is said that $S$ has $\alpha-$rectangular Apéry set if

$$
Ap(S, n_1) = \left \{ \sum_{i = 2}^e \lambda_i n_i ~ | ~ 0 \le \lambda_i \le \alpha_i \right \}.
$$ It can be proven that the inclusion $\subseteq$ is always fulfilled. Moreover, if $S$ is $\alpha-$rectangular, then $S$ is $\beta-$[rectangular](NS-beta-rectangular.qmd) and $\gamma-$[rectangular](NS-gamma-rectangular.qmd).
